snippet: A new rule requiring a company to give the ratio of the top executive’s pay to worker pay will produce an easily grasped and perhaps shocking number.
abstract: Gretchen Morgenson Fair Game column shares reactions from experts to Securities and Exchange Commission rule requiring that companies disclose gap between chief executive pay and what normal workers are paid; notes  previous attempts to curb executive compensation have failed, but contends rule could make disparity easier to grasp and foster more outspoken opposition to large gaps.
lead_paragraph: A new rule requiring a company to give the ratio of the top executive’s pay to worker pay will produce an easily grasped and perhaps shocking number.

headline.print_headline: Cause for Optimism in Curbing C.E.O. Pay
headline.main: Why Putting a Number to C.E.O. Pay Might Bring Change
